page.title: 02BIRDLIP VILLAGE
page.content: Birdlip is a small village with a population of less than 250 situated on the A417 at the top of Birdlip Hill. There is a primary school, an inn, a restaurant, a church, a garage, a Post Office/shop, a village hall and a cricket club. In the village there is a saddlers, a builder and an agricultural contractor who also sells farm machinery. Some of the people work outside the village in places like Gloucester or even as far away as London. Because of the main road which splits the village in two, Birdlip is very noisy with the heavy traffic. Permission has been granted for a by-pass to be built starting in 1987. This will make a tremendous difference to the village. Permission has also been given for a large extension to the George Hotel which is to include a conference centre.
